00248 /**
00249  * cvmx_stx#_arb_ctl
00250  *
00251  * STX_ARB_CTL - Spi transmit arbitration control
00252  *
00253  *
00254  * Notes:
00255  * If STX_ARB_CTL[MINTRN] is set in Spi4 mode, then the data_max_t
00256  * parameter will have to be adjusted.  Please see the
00257  * STX_SPI4_DAT[MAX_T] section for additional information.  In
00258  * addition, the min_burst can only be guaranteed on the initial data
00259  * burst of a given packet (i.e. the first data burst which contains
00260  * the SOP tick).  All subsequent bursts could be truncated by training
00261  * sequences at any point during transmission and could be arbitrarily
00262  * small.  This mode is only for use in Spi4 mode.
00263  */
00264 union cvmx_stxx_arb_ctl {
00265     uint64_t u64;
00266     struct cvmx_stxx_arb_ctl_s {
00267 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00268     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
00269     uint64_t mintrn                       : 1;  /**< Hold off training cycles until STX_MIN_BST[MINB]
00270                                                          is satisfied */
00271     uint64_t reserved_4_4                 : 1;
00272     uint64_t igntpa                       : 1;  /**< User switch to ignore any TPA information from the
00273                                                          Spi interface. This CSR forces all TPA terms to
00274                                                          be masked out.  It is only intended as backdoor
00275                                                          or debug feature. */
00276     uint64_t reserved_0_2                 : 3;
00277 #else
00278     uint64_t reserved_0_2                 : 3;
00279     uint64_t igntpa                       : 1;
00280     uint64_t reserved_4_4                 : 1;
00281     uint64_t mintrn                       : 1;
00282     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
00283 #endif
00284     } s;
00285     struct cvmx_stxx_arb_ctl_s            cn38xx;
00286     struct cvmx_stxx_arb_ctl_s            cn38xxp2;
00287     struct cvmx_stxx_arb_ctl_s            cn58xx;
00288     struct cvmx_stxx_arb_ctl_s            cn58xxp1;
00289 };
00290 typedef union cvmx_stxx_arb_ctl cvmx_stxx_arb_ctl_t;
00291 
00292 /**
00293  * cvmx_stx#_bckprs_cnt
00294  *
00295  * Notes:
00296  * This register reports the total number of cycles (STX data clks -
00297  * stx_clk) in which the port defined in STX_STAT_CTL[BCKPRS] has lost TPA
00298  * or is otherwise receiving backpressure.
00299  *
00300  * In Spi4 mode, this is defined as a loss of TPA which is indicated when
00301  * the receiving device reports SATISFIED for the given port.  The calendar
00302  * status is brought into N2 on the spi4_tx*_sclk and synchronized into the
00303  * N2 Spi TX clock domain which is 1/2 the frequency of the spi4_tx*_dclk
00304  * clock (internally, this the stx_clk).  The counter will update on the
00305  * rising edge in which backpressure is reported.
00306  *
00307  * This register will be cleared when software writes all '1's to
00308  * the STX_BCKPRS_CNT.
00309  */
00310 union cvmx_stxx_bckprs_cnt {
00311     uint64_t u64;
00312     struct cvmx_stxx_bckprs_cnt_s {
00313 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00314     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00315     uint64_t cnt                          : 32; /**< Number of cycles when back-pressure is received
00316                                                          for port defined in STX_STAT_CTL[BCKPRS] */
00317 #else
00318     uint64_t cnt                          : 32;
00319     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00320 #endif
00321     } s;
00322     struct cvmx_stxx_bckprs_cnt_s         cn38xx;
00323     struct cvmx_stxx_bckprs_cnt_s         cn38xxp2;
00324     struct cvmx_stxx_bckprs_cnt_s         cn58xx;
00325     struct cvmx_stxx_bckprs_cnt_s         cn58xxp1;
00326 };
00327 typedef union cvmx_stxx_bckprs_cnt cvmx_stxx_bckprs_cnt_t;
00328

00331  *
00332  * STX_COM_CTL - TX Common Control Register
00333  *
00334  *
00335  * Notes:
00336  * Restrictions:
00337  * Both the calendar table and the LEN and M parameters must be
00338  * completely setup before writing the Interface enable (INF_EN) and
00339  * Status channel enabled (ST_EN) asserted.
00340  */

00347     uint64_t reserved_1_2                 : 2;
00348     uint64_t inf_en                       : 1;  /**< Interface enable */
00349 #else
00350     uint64_t inf_en                       : 1;
00351     uint64_t reserved_1_2                 : 2;
00352     uint64_t st_en                        : 1;
00353     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
00354 #endif
00355     } s;

00357     struct cvmx_stxx_com_ctl_s            cn38xxp2;

00363 /**
00364  * cvmx_stx#_dip_cnt
00365  *
00366  * Notes:
00367  * * DIPMAX
00368  *   This counts the number of consecutive DIP2 states in which the the
00369  *   received DIP2 is bad.  The expected range is 1-15 cycles with the
00370  *   value of 0 meaning disabled.
00371  *
00372  * * FRMMAX
00373  *   This counts the number of consecutive unexpected framing patterns (11)
00374  *   states.  The expected range is 1-15 cycles with the value of 0 meaning
00375  *   disabled.
00376  */
00377 union cvmx_stxx_dip_cnt {
00378     uint64_t u64;
00379     struct cvmx_stxx_dip_cnt_s {
00380 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00381     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00382     uint64_t frmmax                       : 4;  /**< Number of consecutive unexpected framing patterns
00383                                                          before loss of sync */
00384     uint64_t dipmax                       : 4;  /**< Number of consecutive DIP2 error before loss
00385                                                          of sync */
00386 #else
00387     uint64_t dipmax                       : 4;
00388     uint64_t frmmax                       : 4;
00389     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00390 #endif
00391     } s;
00392     struct cvmx_stxx_dip_cnt_s            cn38xx;
00393     struct cvmx_stxx_dip_cnt_s            cn38xxp2;
00394     struct cvmx_stxx_dip_cnt_s            cn58xx;
00395     struct cvmx_stxx_dip_cnt_s            cn58xxp1;
00396 };
00397 typedef union cvmx_stxx_dip_cnt cvmx_stxx_dip_cnt_t;

00399 /**
00400  * cvmx_stx#_ign_cal
00401  *
00402  * STX_IGN_CAL - Ignore Calendar Status from Spi4 Status Channel
00403  *
00404  */
00405 union cvmx_stxx_ign_cal {
00406     uint64_t u64;
00407     struct cvmx_stxx_ign_cal_s {
00408 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00409     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
00410     uint64_t igntpa                       : 16; /**< Ignore Calendar Status from Spi4 Status Channel
00411                                                           per Spi4 port
00412                                                          - 0: Use the status channel info
00413                                                          - 1: Grant the given port MAX_BURST1 credits */
00414 #else
00415     uint64_t igntpa                       : 16;
00416     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
00417 #endif
00418     } s;
00419     struct cvmx_stxx_ign_cal_s            cn38xx;
00420     struct cvmx_stxx_ign_cal_s            cn38xxp2;
00421     struct cvmx_stxx_ign_cal_s            cn58xx;
00422     struct cvmx_stxx_ign_cal_s            cn58xxp1;
00423 };

00426 /**
00427  * cvmx_stx#_int_msk
00428  *
00429  * Notes:
00430  * If the bit is enabled, then the coresponding exception condition will
00431  * result in an interrupt to the system.
00432  */
00433 union cvmx_stxx_int_msk {
00434     uint64_t u64;
00435     struct cvmx_stxx_int_msk_s {
00436 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00437     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00438     uint64_t frmerr                       : 1;  /**< FRMCNT has exceeded STX_DIP_CNT[MAXFRM] */
00439     uint64_t unxfrm                       : 1;  /**< Unexpected framing sequence */
00440     uint64_t nosync                       : 1;  /**< ERRCNT has exceeded STX_DIP_CNT[MAXDIP] */
00441     uint64_t diperr                       : 1;  /**< DIP2 error on the Spi4 Status channel */
00442     uint64_t datovr                       : 1;  /**< Spi4 FIFO overflow error */
00443     uint64_t ovrbst                       : 1;  /**< Transmit packet burst too big */
00444     uint64_t calpar1                      : 1;  /**< STX Calendar Table Parity Error Bank1 */
00445     uint64_t calpar0                      : 1;  /**< STX Calendar Table Parity Error Bank0 */
00446 #else
00447     uint64_t calpar0                      : 1;
00448     uint64_t calpar1                      : 1;
00449     uint64_t ovrbst                       : 1;
00450     uint64_t datovr                       : 1;
00451     uint64_t diperr                       : 1;
00452     uint64_t nosync                       : 1;
00453     uint64_t unxfrm                       : 1;
00454     uint64_t frmerr                       : 1;
00455     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00456 #endif
00457     } s;
00458     struct cvmx_stxx_int_msk_s            cn38xx;
00459     struct cvmx_stxx_int_msk_s            cn38xxp2;
00460     struct cvmx_stxx_int_msk_s            cn58xx;
00461     struct cvmx_stxx_int_msk_s            cn58xxp1;
00462 };
00463 typedef union cvmx_stxx_int_msk cvmx_stxx_int_msk_t;
00464 
00465 /**
00466  * cvmx_stx#_int_reg
00467  *
00468  * Notes:
00469  * * CALPAR0
00470  *   This bit indicates that the Spi4 calendar table encountered a parity
00471  *   error on bank0 of the calendar table memory.  This error bit is
00472  *   associated with the calendar table on the TX interface - the interface
00473  *   that drives the Spi databus.  The calendar table is used in Spi4 mode
00474  *   when using the status channel.  Parity errors can occur during normal
00475  *   operation when the calendar table is constantly being read for the port
00476  *   information, or during initialization time, when the user has access.
00477  *   This errors will force the the status channel to the reset state and
00478  *   begin driving training sequences.  The status channel will also reset.
00479  *   Software must follow the init sequence to resynch the interface.  This
00480  *   includes toggling INF_EN which will cancel all outstanding accumulated
00481  *   credits.
00482  *
00483  * * CALPAR1
00484  *   Identical to CALPAR0 except that it indicates that the error occured
00485  *   on bank1 (instead of bank0).
00486  *
00487  * * OVRBST
00488  *   STX can track upto a 512KB data burst.  Any packet larger than that is
00489  *   illegal and will cause confusion in the STX state machine.  BMI is
00490  *   responsible for throwing away these out of control packets from the
00491  *   input and the Execs should never generate them on the output.  This is
00492  *   a fatal error and should have STX_INT_SYNC[OVRBST] set.
00493  *
00494  * * DATOVR
00495  *   FIFO where the Spi4 data ramps upto its transmit frequency has
00496  *   overflowed.  This is a fatal error and should have
00497  *   STX_INT_SYNC[DATOVR] set.
00498  *
00499  * * DIPERR
00500  *   This bit will fire if any DIP2 error is caught by the Spi4 status
00501  *   channel.
00502  *
00503  * * NOSYNC
00504  *   This bit indicates that the number of consecutive DIP2 errors exceeds
00505  *   STX_DIP_CNT[MAXDIP] and that the interface should be taken down.  The
00506  *   datapath will be notified and send continuous training sequences until
00507  *   software resynchronizes the interface.  This error condition should
00508  *   have STX_INT_SYNC[NOSYNC] set.
00509  *
00510  * * UNXFRM
00511  *   Unexpected framing data was seen on the status channel.
00512  *
00513  * * FRMERR
00514  *   This bit indicates that the number of consecutive unexpected framing
00515  *   sequences STX_DIP_CNT[MAXFRM] and that the interface should be taken
00516  *   down.  The datapath will be notified and send continuous training
00517  *   sequences until software resynchronizes the interface.  This error
00518  *   condition should have STX_INT_SYNC[FRMERR] set.
00519  *
00520  * * SYNCERR
00521  *   Indicates that an exception marked in STX_INT_SYNC has occured and the
00522  *   TX datapath is disabled.  It is recommended that the OVRBST, DATOVR,
00523  *   NOSYNC, and FRMERR error conditions all have their bits set in the
00524  *   STX_INT_SYNC register.
00525  */
00526 union cvmx_stxx_int_reg {
00527     uint64_t u64;
00528     struct cvmx_stxx_int_reg_s {
00529 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00530     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
00531     uint64_t syncerr                      : 1;  /**< Interface encountered a fatal error */
00532     uint64_t frmerr                       : 1;  /**< FRMCNT has exceeded STX_DIP_CNT[MAXFRM] */
00533     uint64_t unxfrm                       : 1;  /**< Unexpected framing sequence */
00534     uint64_t nosync                       : 1;  /**< ERRCNT has exceeded STX_DIP_CNT[MAXDIP] */
00535     uint64_t diperr                       : 1;  /**< DIP2 error on the Spi4 Status channel */
00536     uint64_t datovr                       : 1;  /**< Spi4 FIFO overflow error */
00537     uint64_t ovrbst                       : 1;  /**< Transmit packet burst too big */
00538     uint64_t calpar1                      : 1;  /**< STX Calendar Table Parity Error Bank1 */
00539     uint64_t calpar0                      : 1;  /**< STX Calendar Table Parity Error Bank0 */
00540 #else
00541     uint64_t calpar0                      : 1;
00542     uint64_t calpar1                      : 1;
00543     uint64_t ovrbst                       : 1;
00544     uint64_t datovr                       : 1;
00545     uint64_t diperr                       : 1;
00546     uint64_t nosync                       : 1;
00547     uint64_t unxfrm                       : 1;
00548     uint64_t frmerr                       : 1;
00549     uint64_t syncerr                      : 1;
00550     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
00551 #endif
00552     } s;
00553     struct cvmx_stxx_int_reg_s            cn38xx;
00554     struct cvmx_stxx_int_reg_s            cn38xxp2;
00555     struct cvmx_stxx_int_reg_s            cn58xx;
00556     struct cvmx_stxx_int_reg_s            cn58xxp1;
00557 };
00558 typedef union cvmx_stxx_int_reg cvmx_stxx_int_reg_t;
00559 
00560 /**
00561  * cvmx_stx#_int_sync
00562  *
00563  * Notes:
00564  * If the bit is enabled, then the coresponding exception condition is flagged
00565  * to be fatal.  In Spi4 mode, the exception condition will result in a loss
00566  * of sync condition on the Spi4 interface and the datapath will send
00567  * continuous traing sequences.
00568  *
00569  * It is recommended that software set the OVRBST, DATOVR, NOSYNC, and
00570  * FRMERR errors as synchronization events.  Software is free to
00571  * synchronize the bus on other conditions, but this is the minimum
00572  * recommended set.
00573  */
00574 union cvmx_stxx_int_sync {
00575     uint64_t u64;
00576     struct cvmx_stxx_int_sync_s {
00577 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00578     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00579     uint64_t frmerr                       : 1;  /**< FRMCNT has exceeded STX_DIP_CNT[MAXFRM] */
00580     uint64_t unxfrm                       : 1;  /**< Unexpected framing sequence */
00581     uint64_t nosync                       : 1;  /**< ERRCNT has exceeded STX_DIP_CNT[MAXDIP] */
00582     uint64_t diperr                       : 1;  /**< DIP2 error on the Spi4 Status channel */
00583     uint64_t datovr                       : 1;  /**< Spi4 FIFO overflow error */
00584     uint64_t ovrbst                       : 1;  /**< Transmit packet burst too big */
00585     uint64_t calpar1                      : 1;  /**< STX Calendar Table Parity Error Bank1 */
00586     uint64_t calpar0                      : 1;  /**< STX Calendar Table Parity Error Bank0 */
00587 #else
00588     uint64_t calpar0                      : 1;
00589     uint64_t calpar1                      : 1;
00590     uint64_t ovrbst                       : 1;
00591     uint64_t datovr                       : 1;
00592     uint64_t diperr                       : 1;
00593     uint64_t nosync                       : 1;
00594     uint64_t unxfrm                       : 1;
00595     uint64_t frmerr                       : 1;
00596     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00597 #endif
00598     } s;
00599     struct cvmx_stxx_int_sync_s           cn38xx;
00600     struct cvmx_stxx_int_sync_s           cn38xxp2;
00601     struct cvmx_stxx_int_sync_s           cn58xx;

00618                                                          the number of 8B blocks to send before inserting
00619                                                          a training sequence.  Normally MINB will be set
00620                                                          to GMX_TX_SPI_THRESH[THRESH].  MINB should always
00621                                                          be set to an even number (ie. multiple of 16B) */

00634 /**
00635  * cvmx_stx#_spi4_cal#
00636  *
00637  * specify the RSL base addresses for the block
00638  * STX_SPI4_CAL - Spi4 Calender table
00639  * direct_calendar_write / direct_calendar_read
00640  *
00641  * Notes:
00642  * There are 32 calendar table CSR's, each containing 4 entries for a
00643  *     total of 128 entries.  In the above definition...
00644  *
00645  *           n = calendar table offset * 4
00646  *
00647  *        Example, offset 0x00 contains the calendar table entries 0, 1, 2, 3
00648  *        (with n == 0).  Offset 0x10 is the 16th entry in the calendar table
00649  *        and would contain entries (16*4) = 64, 65, 66, and 67.
00650  *
00651  * Restrictions:
00652  *        Calendar table entry accesses (read or write) can only occur
00653  *        if the interface is disabled.  All other accesses will be
00654  *        unpredictable.
00655  *
00656  *     Both the calendar table and the LEN and M parameters must be
00657  *     completely setup before writing the Interface enable (INF_EN) and
00658  *     Status channel enabled (ST_EN) asserted.
00659  */
00660 union cvmx_stxx_spi4_calx {
00661     uint64_t u64;
00662     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_calx_s {
00663 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00664     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
00665     uint64_t oddpar                       : 1;  /**< Odd parity over STX_SPI4_CAL[15:0]
00666                                                          (^STX_SPI4_CAL[16:0] === 1'b1)                  |   $NS       NS */
00667     uint64_t prt3                         : 4;  /**< Status for port n+3 */
00668     uint64_t prt2                         : 4;  /**< Status for port n+2 */
00669     uint64_t prt1                         : 4;  /**< Status for port n+1 */
00670     uint64_t prt0                         : 4;  /**< Status for port n+0 */
00671 #else
00672     uint64_t prt0                         : 4;
00673     uint64_t prt1                         : 4;
00674     uint64_t prt2                         : 4;
00675     uint64_t prt3                         : 4;
00676     uint64_t oddpar                       : 1;
00677     uint64_t reserved_17_63               : 47;
00678 #endif
00679     } s;
00680     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_calx_s          cn38xx;
00681     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_calx_s          cn38xxp2;
00682     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_calx_s          cn58xx;
00683     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_calx_s          cn58xxp1;
00684 };
00685 typedef union cvmx_stxx_spi4_calx cvmx_stxx_spi4_calx_t;
00686 
00687 /**
00688  * cvmx_stx#_spi4_dat
00689  *
00690  * STX_SPI4_DAT - Spi4 datapath channel control register
00691  *
00692  *
00693  * Notes:
00694  * Restrictions:
00695  * * DATA_MAX_T must be in MOD 4 cycles
00696  *
00697  * * DATA_MAX_T must at least 0x20
00698  *
00699  * * DATA_MAX_T == 0 or ALPHA == 0 will disable the training sequnce
00700  *
00701  * * If STX_ARB_CTL[MINTRN] is set, then training cycles will stall
00702  *   waiting for min bursts to complete.  In the worst case, this will
00703  *   add the entire min burst transmission time to the interval between
00704  *   trainging sequence.  The observed MAX_T on the Spi4 bus will be...
00705  *
00706  *                STX_SPI4_DAT[MAX_T] + (STX_MIN_BST[MINB] * 4)
00707  *
00708  *      If STX_ARB_CTL[MINTRN] is set in Spi4 mode, then the data_max_t
00709  *      parameter will have to be adjusted.  Please see the
00710  *      STX_SPI4_DAT[MAX_T] section for additional information.  In
00711  *      addition, the min_burst can only be guaranteed on the initial data
00712  *      burst of a given packet (i.e. the first data burst which contains
00713  *      the SOP tick).  All subsequent bursts could be truncated by training
00714  *      sequences at any point during transmission and could be arbitrarily
00715  *      small.  This mode is only for use in Spi4 mode.
00716  */
00717 union cvmx_stxx_spi4_dat {
00718     uint64_t u64;
00719     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_dat_s {
00720 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00721     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00722     uint64_t alpha                        : 16; /**< alpha (from spi4.2 spec) */
00723     uint64_t max_t                        : 16; /**< DATA_MAX_T (from spi4.2 spec) */
00724 #else
00725     uint64_t max_t                        : 16;
00726     uint64_t alpha                        : 16;
00727     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00728 #endif
00729     } s;
00730     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_dat_s           cn38xx;
00731     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_dat_s           cn38xxp2;
00732     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_dat_s           cn58xx;
00733     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_dat_s           cn58xxp1;
00734 };
00735 typedef union cvmx_stxx_spi4_dat cvmx_stxx_spi4_dat_t;
00736

00738  * cvmx_stx#_spi4_stat
00739  *
00740  * STX_SPI4_STAT - Spi4 status channel control register
00741  *
00742  *
00743  * Notes:
00744  * Restrictions:
00745  * Both the calendar table and the LEN and M parameters must be
00746  * completely setup before writing the Interface enable (INF_EN) and
00747  * Status channel enabled (ST_EN) asserted.
00748  *
00749  * The calendar table will only be enabled when LEN > 0.
00750  *
00751  * Current rev will only support LVTTL status IO.
00752  */

00759     uint64_t reserved_7_7                 : 1;
00760     uint64_t len                          : 7;  /**< CALENDAR_LEN (from spi4.2 spec) */
00761 #else
00762     uint64_t len                          : 7;
00763     uint64_t reserved_7_7                 : 1;
00764     uint64_t m                            : 8;
00765     uint64_t reserved_16_63               : 48;
00766 #endif
00767     } s;
00768     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_stat_s          cn38xx;
00769     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_stat_s          cn38xxp2;

00771     struct cvmx_stxx_spi4_stat_s          cn58xxp1;
00772 };
